member.summary: Contains settings for configuring various file-transfer options.

member.summary: A reference to the Socks5Bytestreams extension.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Client.FileTransferSettings.siFileTransfer
member.summary: A reference to the SIFileTransfer extension.

member.name: P:Artalk.Xmpp.Client.FileTransferSettings.ProxyAllowed
member.summary: Determines whether usage of a SOCKS5 proxy server is allowed.

member.name: P:Artalk.Xmpp.Client.FileTransferSettings.Proxies
member.summary: A collection of user-defined SOCKS5 proxy servers.

member.name: P:Artalk.Xmpp.Client.FileTransferSettings.Socks5ServerPortFrom
member.summary: Defines, along with the Socks5ServerPortTo property, a range of ports eligible for creating SOCKS5 servers on.
member.exception: The property is being set and the value is negative, or the value is greater than the value of the Socks5ServerPortTo property.

member.name: P:Artalk.Xmpp.Client.FileTransferSettings.Socks5ServerPortTo
member.summary: Defines, along with the Socks5ServerPortFrom property, a range of ports eligible for creating SOCKS5 servers on.
member.exception: The property is being set and the value the value is smaller than the value of the Socks5ServerPortFrom property, or the value is greater than 65535.

member.name: P:Artalk.Xmpp.Client.FileTransferSettings.UseUPnP
member.summary: Determines whether usage of UPnP for automatic port-forwarding is allowed.

member.name: P:Artalk.Xmpp.Client.FileTransferSettings.StunServer
member.summary: The STUN server to use for determining the external IP address of the XMPP client.
member.remarks: The default STUN server is "stun.l.google.com:19302".

member.name: P:Artalk.Xmpp.Client.FileTransferSettings.ForceInBandBytestreams
member.summary: Determines whether the in-band bytestreams method should be used, even if the preferred SOCKS5 method is available.

member.name: T:Artalk.Xmpp.Client.ArtalkXmppClient
member.summary: Implements an XMPP client providing basic instant messaging (IM) and presence functionality as well as various XMPP extension functionality.
member.remarks: This provides most of the functionality exposed by the XmppIm class but simplifies some of the more complicated aspects such as privacy lists and roster management. It also implements various XMPP protocol extensions.

member.exception: The message parameter is null.

member.name: M:Artalk.Xmpp.Core.Sasl.Mechanisms.SaslScramSha1.Hi(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the "Hi()"-formula which is part of the client's response to the server challenge.
member.param: The supplied password to use.
The salt received from the server.
The iteration count.
member.returns: An array of bytes containing the result of the computation of the "Hi()"-formula.
member.remarks: Hi is, essentially, PBKDF2 with HMAC as the pseudorandom function (PRF) and with dkLen == output length of HMAC() == output length of H(). (Refer to RFC 5802, p.6)

member.returns: The hashcode of the specified data input.

member.summary: Applies the HMAC keyed hash algorithm using the specified key to the specified input string.

member.summary: Computes the client response to a challenge sent by the server.

member.name: M:Artalk.Xmpp.Core.Sasl.SaslMechanism.GetResponse(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the base64-encoded client response for the specified base64-encoded challenge sent by the server.
member.param: A base64-encoded string representing a challenge sent by the server.
member.returns: A base64-encoded string representing the client response to the server challenge.
member.remarks: The IMAP, POP3 and SMTP authentication commands expect challenges and responses to be base64-encoded. This method automatically decodes the server challenge before passing it to the Sasl implementation and encodes the client response to a base64-string before returning it to the caller.
member.exception: The client response could not be retrieved. Refer to the inner exception for error details.

member.name: M:Artalk.Xmpp.Core.Sasl.SaslMechanism.GetResponse(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Retrieves the client response for the specified server challenge.
member.param: A byte array containing the challenge sent by the server.
member.returns: An array of bytes representing the client response to the server challenge.

member.summary: A collection of cached UPnP-devices.

member.exception: Querying for UPnP-enabled devices failed, or an error occurred while obtaining an external IP address.

member.name: M:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Upnp.UPnP.ForwardPort(System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Net.Sockets.ProtocolType},System.String)
member.summary: Forwards the specified port, optionally for the specified protocol only.
member.param: The port to forward.

If specified, must be either ProcotolType.Tcp or ProtocolType.Udp to forward the port only for the TCP or the UDP protocol, respectively. If this is null, the port will be forwarded for both protocols.
A description of the port-forwarding rule that may be displayed in the UPnP-device's user interface to help the user better understand what the port-forwarding rule is for.
member.exception: The port parameter is not between 0 and 65535.
The protocol parameter has a value other than ProtocolType.Tcp or ProtocolType.Udp.
Querying for UPnP-enabled devices failed, or an error occurred while trying to forward the specified port.

member.name: M:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Upnp.UPnP.UnforwardPort(System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Net.Sockets.ProtocolType})
member.summary: Removes existing port-mappings of the specified port.
member.param: The port to "unforward".

If specified, must be either ProcotolType.Tcp or ProtocolType.Udp to unforward the port only for the TCP or the UDP protocol, respectively. If this is null, the port will be unforwarded for both protocols.
member.exception: The port parameter is not between 0 and 65535.
The protocol parameter has a value other than ProtocolType.Tcp or ProtocolType.Udp.

member.name: M:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Upnp.UPnP.ForwardPort(UPNPLib.UPnPDevice,System.Net.IPAddress,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Net.Sockets.ProtocolType},System.String)
member.summary: Forwards the specified port on the specified WAN device, optionally for the specified protocol only.
member.param: The UPnP WAN device to forward the port on.
The IP address to forward the port to.
The port to forward.

If specified, must be either ProcotolType.Tcp or ProtocolType.Udp to forward the port only for the TCP or the UDP protocol, respectively. If this is null, the port will be forwarded for both protocols.
A description of the port-forwarding rule that may be displayed in the UPnP-device's user interface to help the user better understand what the port-forwarding rule is for.
member.exception: The wanDevice parameter or the targetAddress parameter is null.
The port parameter is not between 0 and 65535.
The protocol parameter has a value other than ProtocolType.Tcp or ProtocolType.Udp.
An error occurred while trying to forward the specified port.

member.name: M:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Upnp.UPnP.UnforwardPort(UPNPLib.UPnPDevice,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Net.Sockets.ProtocolType})
member.summary: Removes existing port-mappings of the specified port from the specified UPnP WAN device.
member.param: The UPnP WAN device to unforward the port on.
The port to "unforward".

If specified, must be either ProcotolType.Tcp or ProtocolType.Udp to unforward the port only for the TCP or the UDP protocol, respectively. If this is null, the port will be unforwarded for both protocols.
member.exception: The wanDevice parameter is null.
The port parameter is not between 0 and 65535.
The protocol parameter has a value other than ProtocolType.Tcp or ProtocolType.Udp.
An error occurred while trying to unforward the specified port.
member.remarks: Trying to remove a non-existing port-mapping will cause an InvalidOperationException.

member.name: M:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Upnp.UPnP.VerifyCache
member.summary: Ensures the cached items are still valid and if necessary refreshes the cache.
member.exception: An error occurred while performing an SSDP search-operation.

member.name: M:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Upnp.UPnP.FindDevices(System.String,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Performs a search for UPnP devices on all active network interfaces.
member.param: The search target. If this is null, a search for all UPnP devices will be performed.
The timespan after which to cancel the search and return the results to the caller. If this is null, the method blocks until the search has been completed.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of discovered UPnP devices.
member.exception: An error occurred while performing an SSDP search-operation.
member.remarks:
A full UPnP search can take 9 seconds or longer;
Possible values for the searchTarget parameter include: * ssdp:all (searches for all devices and services) * ssdp:rootdevice (searches for root devices only) For details on all possible values for the searchTarget parameter, refer to the 'UPnP Device Architecture 1.1' document, page 33.

member.name: T:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood
member.summary: Defines possible values for the mood of an XMPP user.
member.remarks: Refer to XEP-0107 for a detailed listing and description of the various mood values.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Afraid
member.summary: Impressed with fear or apprehension; in fear; apprehensive.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Amazed
member.summary: Astonished; confounded with fear, surprise or wonder.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Amarous
member.summary: Inclined to love; having a propensity to love, or to sexual enjoyment; loving, fond, affectionate, passionate, lustful, sexual, etc.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Angry
member.summary: Displaying or feeling anger, i.e., a strong feeling of displeasure, hostility or antagonism towards someone or something, usually combined with an urge to harm.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Annoyed
member.summary: To be disturbed or irritated, especially by continued or repeated acts.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Anxious
member.summary: Full of anxiety or disquietude; greatly concerned or solicitous, esp. respecting something future or unknown; being in painful suspense.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Aroused
member.summary: To be stimulated in one's feelings, especially to be sexually stimulated.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Ashamed
member.summary: Feeling shame or guilt.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Bored
member.summary: Suffering from boredom; uninterested, without attention.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Brave
member.summary: Strong in the face of fear; courageous.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Calm
member.summary: Peaceful, quiet.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Cautious
member.summary: Taking care or caution; tentative.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Cold
member.summary: Feeling the sensation of coldness, especially to the point of discomfort.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Confident
member.summary: Feeling very sure of or positive about something, especially about one's own capabilities.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Confused
member.summary: Chaotic, jumbled or muddled.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Contemplative
member.summary: Feeling introspective or thoughtful.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Contented
member.summary: Pleased at the satisfaction of a want or desire; satisfied.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Cranky
member.summary: Grouchy, irritable; easily upset.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Crazy
member.summary: Feeling out of control; feeling overly excited or enthusiastic.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Creative
member.summary: Feeling original, expressive, or imaginative.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Curious
member.summary: Inquisitive; tending to ask questions, investigate, or explore.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Dejected
member.summary: Feeling sad and dispirited.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Depressed
member.summary: Severely despondent and unhappy.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Disappointed
member.summary: Defeated of expectation or hope; let down.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Disgusted
member.summary: Filled with disgust; irritated and out of patience.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Dismayed
member.summary: Feeling a sudden or complete loss of courage in the face of trouble or danger.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Distracted
member.summary: Having one's attention diverted; preoccupied.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Embarrassed
member.summary: Having a feeling of shameful discomfort.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Envious
member.summary: Feeling pain by the excellence or good fortune of another.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Excited
member.summary: Having great enthusiasm.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Flirtatious
member.summary: In the mood for flirting.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Frustrated
member.summary: Suffering from frustration; dissatisfied, agitated, or discontented because one is unable to perform an action or fulfill a desire.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Grateful
member.summary: Feeling appreciation or thanks.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Grieving
member.summary: Feeling very sad about something, especially something lost; mournful; sorrowful.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Grumpy
member.summary: Unhappy and irritable.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Guilty
member.summary: Feeling responsible for wrongdoing; feeling blameworthy.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Happy
member.summary: Experiencing the effect of favourable fortune; having the feeling arising from the consciousness of well-being or of enjoyment; enjoying good of any kind, as peace, tranquillity, comfort; contented; joyous.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Hopeful
member.summary: Having a positive feeling, belief, or expectation that something wished for can or will happen.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Hot
member.summary: Feeling the sensation of heat, especially to the point of discomfort.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Humbled
member.summary: Having or showing a modest or low estimate of one's own importance; feeling lowered in dignity or importance.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Humiliated
member.summary: Feeling deprived of dignity or self-respect.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Hungry
member.summary: Having a physical need for food.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Hurt
member.summary: Wounded, injured, or pained, whether physically or emotionally.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Impressed
member.summary: Favourably affected by something or someone.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.InAwe
member.summary: Feeling amazement at something or someone; or feeling a combination of fear and reverence.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.InLove
member.summary: Feeling strong affection, care, liking, or attraction.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Indignant
member.summary: Showing anger or indignation, especially at something unjust or wrong.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Interested
member.summary: Showing great attention to something or someone; having or showing interest.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Intoxicated
member.summary: Under the influence of alcohol; drunk.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Invincible
member.summary: Feeling as if one cannot be defeated, overcome or denied.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Jealous
member.summary: Fearful of being replaced in position or affection.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Lonely
member.summary: Feeling isolated, empty, or abandoned.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Lost
member.summary: Unable to find one's way, either physically or emotionally.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Lucky
member.summary: Feeling as if one will be favored by luck.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Mean
member.summary: Causing or intending to cause intentional harm; bearing ill will towards another; cruel; malicious.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Moody
member.summary: Given to sudden or frequent changes of mind or feeling; temperamental.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Nervous
member.summary: Easily agitated or alarmed; apprehensive or anxious.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Neutral
member.summary: Not having a strong mood or emotional state.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Offended
member.summary: Feeling emotionally hurt, displeased, or insulted.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Outraged
member.summary: Feeling resentful anger caused by an extremely violent or vicious attack, or by an offensive, immoral, or indecent act.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Playful
member.summary: Interested in play; fun, recreational, unserious, lighthearted; joking, silly.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Proud
member.summary: Feeling a sense of one's own worth or accomplishment.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Relaxed
member.summary: Having an easy-going mood; not stressed; calm.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Relieved
member.summary: Feeling uplifted because of the removal of stress or discomfort.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Remorseful
member.summary: Feeling regret or sadness for doing something wrong.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Restless
member.summary: Without rest; unable to be still or quiet; uneasy; continually moving.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Sad
member.summary: Feeling sorrow; sorrowful, mournful.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Sarcastic
member.summary: Mocking and ironical.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Satisfied
member.summary: Pleased at the fulfillment of a need or desire.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Serious
member.summary: Without humor or expression of happiness; grave in manner or disposition; earnest; thoughtful; solemn.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Shocked
member.summary: Surprised, startled, confused, or taken aback.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Shy
member.summary: Feeling easily frightened or scared; timid; reserved or coy.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Sick
member.summary: Feeling in poor health; ill.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Sleepy
member.summary: Feeling the need for sleep.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Spontaneous
member.summary: Acting without planning; natural; impulsive.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Stressed
member.summary: Suffering emotional pressure.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Strong
member.summary: Capable of producing great physical force; or, emotionally forceful, able, determined, unyielding.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Surprised
member.summary: Experiencing a feeling caused by something unexpected.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Thankful
member.summary: Showing appreciation or gratitude.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Thirsty
member.summary: Feeling the need to drink.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Tired
member.summary: In need of rest or sleep.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Undefined
member.summary: [Feeling any emotion not defined here.]

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Weak
member.summary: Lacking in force or ability, either physical or emotional.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Mood.Worried
member.summary: Thinking about unpleasant things that have happened or that might happen; feeling afraid and unhappy.

member.summary: A URI or URL pointing to information about the song, collection, or artist.

member.param: The title of the song or piece.
The artist or performer of the song or piece.
A unique identifier for the tune; e.g., the track number within a collection or the specific URI for the object (e.g., a stream or audio file).
The duration of the song or piece in seconds.
The user's rating of the song or piece, from 1 (lowest) to 10 (highest).
The collection (e.g., album) or other source (e.g., a band website that hosts streams or audio files).
A URI or URL pointing to information about the song, collection, or artist
member.exception: The server does not support the 'Personal Eventing Protocol' extension.
The server returned an XMPP error code. Use the Error property of the XmppErrorException to obtain the specific error condition.
The server returned invalid data or another unspecified XMPP error occurred.
member.remarks: Publishing no information (i.e. calling Publish without any parameters is considered a "stop command" to disable publishing).

member.name: M:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.UserTune.Publish(Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.TuneInformation)
member.summary: Publishes the specified music information to contacts on the user's roster.
member.param: The tune information to publish.
member.exception: The tune parameter is null.
The server does not support the 'Personal Eventing Protocol' extension.
The server returned an XMPP error code. Use the Error property of the XmppErrorException to obtain the specific error condition.
The server returned invalid data or another unspecified XMPP error occurred.
member.remarks: Publishing no information (i.e. calling Publish without any parameters is considered a "stop command" to disable publishing).

member.name: T:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension
member.summary: An enumeration of supported XMPP extensions.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.ServiceDiscovery
member.summary: An extension for discovering information about other XMPP entities.
member.remarks: Defined in XEP-0030.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.SoftwareVersion
member.summary: An extension for retrieving information about the software application associated with an XMPP entity.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.EntityCapabilities
member.summary: An extension for broadcasting and dynamically discovering client, device, or generic entity capabilities.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.Ping
member.summary: An extension for sending application-level pings over XML streams.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.Attention
member.summary: An extension for getting the attention of another user.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.EntityTime
member.summary: An extension for communicating the local time of an entity.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.BlockingCommand
member.summary: An extension for communications blocking that is intended to be simpler than privacy lists.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.PersonalEventingProcotol
member.summary: An extension for publishing and subscribing to broadcast state change events associated with an instant messaging and presence account.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.UserTune
member.summary: An extension for communicating information about music to which a user is listening, including the title, track number, length and others.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.UserAvatar
member.summary: An extension for exchanging user avatars, which are small images or icons associated with human users.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.UserMood
member.summary: An extension for for communicating information about user moods, such as whether a person is currently happy, sad, angy, or annoyed.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.DataForms
member.summary: An extension extension for data forms that can be used in workflows such as service configuration as well as for application-specific data description and reporting.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.FeatureNegotiation
member.summary: An extension that enables two entities to mutually negotiate feature options, such as parameters related to a file transfer or a communications session.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.StreamInitiation
member.summary: An extension for initiating a data stream between any two XMPP entities.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.SIFileTransfer
member.summary: An extension for transferring files between two entities.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.InBandBytestreams
member.summary: An extension that enables any two entities to establish a one-to-one bytestream between themselves, where the data is broken down into smaller chunks and transported in-band over XMPP.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.UserActivity
member.summary: An extension for communicating information about user activities, such as whether a person is currently working, travelling, or relaxing.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.Socks5Bytestreams
member.summary: An extension for establishing an out-of-band bytestream between any two XMPP users, mainly for the purpose of file transfer.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.ServerIpCheck
member.summary: An extension that enables a client to discover its external IP address.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.InBandRegistration
member.summary: An extension for in-band registration with XMPP-based instant messaging servers and other services hosted on an XMPP network.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.BitsOfBinary
member.summary: An extension for including or referring to small bits of binary data in an XML stanza.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.Extensions.Extension.ChatStateNotifications
member.summary: An extension for communicating the status of a user in a chat session, thus indicating whether a chat partner is actively engaged in the chat, composing a message, temporarily paused, inactive, or gone.

member.name: T:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition
member.summary: Defines possible values for the condition of XMPP errors.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.BadRequest
member.summary: The sender has sent XML that is malformed or that cannot be processed.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.Conflict
member.summary: Access cannot be granted because an existing resource or session exists with the same name or address.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.FeatureNotImplemented
member.summary: The feature requested is not implemented by the recipient or server and therefore cannot be processed.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.Forbidden
member.summary: The requesting entity does not possess the required permissions to perform the action.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.Gone
member.summary: The recipient or server can no longer be contacted at this address.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.InternalServerError
member.summary: The server could not process the stanza because of a misconfiguration or an otherwise-undefined internal server error.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.ItemNotFound
member.summary: The addressed JID or item requested cannot be found.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.JidMalformed
member.summary: The sending entity has provided or communicated an XMPP address or aspect thereof that does not adhere to the XMPP syntax.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.NotAcceptable
member.summary: The recipient or server understands the request but is refusing to process it.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.NotAllowed
member.summary: The recipient or server does not allow any entity to perform the action.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.NotAuthorized
member.summary: The sender must provide proper credentials before being allowed to perform the action, or has provided improper credentials.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.PaymentRequired
member.summary: The requesting entity is not authorized to access the requested service because payment is required.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.RecipientUnavailable
member.summary: The intended recipient is temporarily unavailable.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.Redirect
member.summary: The recipient or server is redirecting requests for this information to another entity, usually temporarily.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.RegistrationRequired
member.summary: The requesting entity is not authorized to access the requested service because registration is required.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.RemoteServerNotFound
member.summary: A remote server or service specified as part or all of the JID of the intended recipient does not exist.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.RemoteServerTimeout
member.summary: A remote server or service specified as part or all of the JID of the intended recipient could not be contacted within a reasonable amount of time.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.ResourceConstraint
member.summary: The server or recipient lacks the system resources necessary to service the request.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: The server or recipient does not currently provide the requested service.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.SubscriptionRequired
member.summary: The requesting entity is not authorized to access the requested service because a subscription is required.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.UndefinedCondition
member.summary: The error condition is not one of those defined by the other conditions in this enumeration.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorCondition.UnexpectedRequest
member.summary: The recipient or server understood the request but was not expecting it at this time (e.g., the request was out of order).

member.name: T:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorType
member.summary: Defines possible values for the type of XMPP errors.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorType.Cancel
member.summary: Do not retry (the error is unrecoverable).

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorType.Continue
member.summary: Proceed (the condition was only a warning).

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorType.Modify
member.summary: Retry after changing the data sent.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorType.Auth
member.summary: Retry after providing credentials.

member.name: F:Artalk.Xmpp.ErrorType.Wait
member.summary: Retry after waiting (the error is temporary).
